alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:48PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, southeastern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and Pearl River Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Enon, or 11 miles south of Franklinton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Picayune, Poplarville, Sun, Bush, Enon, Crossroads and Mcneil. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 5 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
